reviews.review_msg: John Henry is a super down to earth professor, one who changes the course to fit the needs of the class at will. Definitely would take again. Can't comment on lower level classes, but a must-take for HIST majors in 3rd or 4th year
does not release grades at all in a timely manner

Goes out of his way for his students, has helped me and other students find sources for our final papers after reading our prospectus. He fosters a wonderful environment in his classroom and discussions are always lively. Overall fantastic guy and great prof, put in even a little effort and you'll do well in the class.

Seminar was great as everyone participated and the prof did well to facilitate conversation. In lower and upper div classes, if you do the work and readings you will do well in all his classes. He is also a fair marker who provides suitable feedback where necessary. Lower div lectures are very dry but just do the work and you will succeed.
Dr. May is a great prof!! Lots of reading but you learn a lot! You need to read every class but not a lot of homework. I would take his class again!

Dr. May is an excellent professor. You can tell he really cares about his field of study. Participation definitely matters and if you find yourself struggling with anything at all in class, don't be scared to reach out to him during office hours or a quick e-mail (100% will help)! Also doesn't hurt that he's cute :-)

He is by far one of my most favorite profs I had at SFU. He's one of those professors you recall a year or two after you've graduated and smile. Wonderful guy, genuinely wants to help you. Those who do poorly are the ones that dont attened his class because they find it boring.

This is the second class I've had with Seager, and I think he is much better suited to this seminar style over a lecture. You can tell he is really passionate and wants his students to get all that they can out of the class. I wish he had lectured a bit more (class was a bit heavy on peer presentations) but the field trips/arts & crafts were great!

I am nearing the end of this term and have 1 more class with him. I'm sad, I'll admit it. He is wonderful. It seems from the comments that if you are 1st yr he's not so good but upper div he's awesome. I look forward to every class. I'm a french major so it's my only english class. He's smart,funny,helpful,encouraging.One of the best profs ever!

While the topics can be quite boring, this class was very much student lead. We each did a small presentation on the reading material each week. He was nice and a fair marker, I really have nothing to complain about.
Great prof.  He's one of the professor's you'll remember when your in an office job down the road.  He makes a difficult job look easy.
This teacher rocks.  Way too cool for academia.

This teacher is great.  He has a very good memory for facts and figures, and enjoys working with students that are interested in the topic.  If you make an effort you'll have a good time and learn something.

Good prof, knows his stuff.  Allen isn't exactly clear on what he wants assignment wise, however he is a very fair marker.  I learned quite a bit about Canadian culture and I'd take another class with him.

Great prof. Knows is stuff, one of the better prof at SFU history. Easy going, lectures are a breeze, FAIR marker, learned some new things about Cdn history.  Happy I took the course with him over other profs

WORSE PROFESSOR AND CLASS EVER! If you have ANY problems with your writing avoid him. His expectations is that you should share his views on the subject and will throughly tear apart your argument if you disagree with him. He also has a very limited idea of landscape and if your definition doesn't fit his good luck. I would avoid taking his class!

Dr. Little is a brilliant historian who cares passionately about his work and his students.  I suspect that the majority of negative responses posted below are authored by students who have no interest in Canadian history except to the extent that it is a requisite of the PDP program.

Made me want to give up on a history major! Not approachable. To get an A you need to suck-up alot and do 10times the work then the rest of the class. Waste of time. Bad lecturer. Knows his stuff but is so damn COCKY!!!

Worst lecturer and toughest marker in hist dept. Unless ur a honors hist major or someone with an amazing english writing background, also willing to stay up for boring lectures from a monotone voice and willing to be intimidated by his closed personality...then take him! he is not approachable.
A wonderful prof. Great course and fun learning environment.  Just do your homework and come prepare to class and you'll do just fine.
